UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the ReCycleConnect application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

userId.description: The unique ID from Firebase Authentication.

photoURL.description: The URL to the user's profile picture. This can be null or empty if they don't have one.

lastKnownLocality.description: The user's last selected locality for browsing items.

ratingIds.description: References to Ratings given or received by this user. (Relationship: User 1:N Rating)

reportedItemIds.description: References to Items reported by this user. (Relationship: User 1:N Item)

wishlistItemIds.description: References to Items saved in user's wishlist. (Relationship: User 1:N Item)

Item.title: Item
Item.description: Represents an item listed for exchange on ReCycleConnect.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. The document ID is the Firebase Authentication UID (`userId`).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID from Firebase Authentication, used as the document ID.

definition.description: Stores all items listed on the platform.

params.name: itemId
params.description: The unique ID for the item.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the ReCycleConnect application's user profiles and related data, focusing on secure access and efficient queries. The primary collection, `users`, stores user profile information. To ensure authorization independence, the `users` collection uses path-based ownership, which simplifies security rules. This structure supports the required QAPs (Queries and Permissions) by segregating user data into a dedicated collection, and access control can be easily managed through Firebase Authentication and security rules. The `userId` is used as document ID. Additionally, the structure denormalizes the relationship between users and ratings, reported items, and wishlist items by storing references (IDs) within the user document itself, avoiding the need for complex joins or subcollection queries when fetching basic user profile information. The `items` collection stores all listed items, with a `locality` field to enable efficient location-based filtering.
